channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4889] Function and Department not transferred to SAP
item.description: During customer creation and change the Function and Department field are not transferred to SAP
item.summary: Function and Department not transferred to SAP

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Nabil,
Please estimate and start.

Hi,

According to DISTRELEC-3898, there is no one to one mapping with ELFA values. The mapping was fixed already?
fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4874] DE // Deactive User Management
item.description: Please deactivate the user management section in the my account for Germany.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4755] Test DE // Open Orders - no possibility to add more products to an existing open order
item.description:
account: andre.hoffmann@distrelec.com
pass: sap@distrelec

orders: 4395 and 4396 are open orders.

no possibility to add more products to the existing open orders.
item.summary: Test DE // Open Orders - no possibility to add more products to an existing open order

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Evanglos,

Could you please have a look why we have exception while making call for read all open orders. Please see below the request and response xml :-

Request xml:- 


<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soap:Body>
		<ns2:ReadAllOpenOrdersRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
			<salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>
			<customerId>0001241009</customerId>
		</ns2:ReadAllOpenOrdersRequest>
	</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

response xml :- 


<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/'>
	<SOAP:Header/>
	<SOAP:Body>
		<SOAP:Fault>
			<faultcode>SOAP:Server</faultcode>
			<faultstring>Server Error</faultstring>
			<detail>
				<ns1:FaultMessage xmlns:ns1='http://www.distrelec.com/hybris'>
					<faultId>00</faultId>
					<faultName>Information was not found. Please check your data.</faultName>
					<faultText/>
				</ns1:FaultMessage>
			</detail>
		</SOAP:Fault>
	</SOAP:Body>
</SOAP:Envelope>

Hello Neeraj,
It seems that this customer has no open order. All the orders that were placed under this customer has been delivered.
Can you please a new open order and try again? I tried to do so but it was failing

Hi Oana,

we find the root cause of the issue and has been fixed now. It will be available in the next deployment.

Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4673] DE // OpenOrders: Missing menue in my account
item.description: The category "open order" is missing in the my account
item.summary: DE // OpenOrders: Missing menue in my account

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
i've activated the link for all the countries that uses SAP.
There is a display problem in case the open-order-history link is clicked, the page is displayed correctly, but on the side bar the link is not marked as the active link.

@Florian
Could you please assign the ticket to a frontend engineer?

Hi Ruben
there is only one small issue when the link is clicked by the customer.
The link should become active, but it doesn't.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4495] IF-16 Invoice History: soap error with customer 1000391
item.description:
hi Maciej
i get an error while executing the invoice history in New SAP Development.

com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: Error encountered while executing mapping: com.sap.aii.af.service.mapping.MappingException: Runtime Exception when executing appli
cation mapping program com/sap/xi/tf/MM_IF16_SearchInvoices_to_IF16_SearchInvoices_Response; Details: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException; Cannot create target element /ns1:InvoiceSearchResponse/invoices/orders. Values missing in queue context. Target
XSD requires a value for this element, but the target-field mapping does not create one. Check whether the XML instance is valid for the source XSD, and whether the target-field mapping fulfils the requirement of the target XSD

In the attachment the soap request /response.

Could you please have a look?
item.summary: IF-16 Invoice History: soap error with customer 1000391

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I just run it and got correct response:

<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
<SOAP:Header/>
<SOAP:Body>
<ns1:InvoiceSearchResponse xmlns:ns1="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
<customerId>1000391</customerId>
<invoices>
<invoiceId>7350000014</invoiceId>
<invoiceDate>20140609</invoiceDate>
<invoiceDueDate>20140609</invoiceDueDate>
<invoiceStatus>Open</invoiceStatus>
<invoiceTotal>15.67</invoiceTotal>
<currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
<orders>
<orderId>1000000035</orderId>
<contactName>Detlef Bartelt</contactName>
</orders>
<invoiceDocId/>
</invoices>
...
</ns1:InvoiceSearchResponse>
</SOAP:Body>
</SOAP:Envelope>

Could you please check once again?

Hi Maciej
i get the same error.

could you please try this request:

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
<soap:Body>
<ns2:InvoiceSearchRequest xmlns:ns2="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">
<salesOrganization>7350</salesOrganization>
<customerId>0001000391</customerId>
<filterCurrencyCode>EUR</filterCurrencyCode>
<sortCriteria>TOTAL</sortCriteria>
<sortAscending>false</sortAscending>
<resultSize>10</resultSize>
<resultOffset>0</resultOffset>
</ns2:InvoiceSearchRequest>
</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

This is the endpoint i'm using:
http://daechs062u.dae.datwyler.biz:50000/XISOAPAdapter/MessageServlet?senderParty=&senderService=WSD&receiverParty=&receiverService=&interface=SI_Hybris_v1_out&interfaceNamespace=http://www.distrelec.com/hybris

It works fine, too. Here's the WSDL, but it hasn't changed in a long time:
http://daechs060u.dae.datwyler.biz:50000/dir/wsdl?p=ic/a5ca22b375083bff9878c6cf06dfd734

--edit:

sorry, I was testing on Q.
Given request results in response with <invoices> element that doesn't contain mandatory <orders> element and it fails in PI. Could you please check it? It fails on D10, but works fine on Q10.

Hi Evangelos,

It seems that in D10 is selected an invoice (7350000013) which is an exception for the order selection logic.
We select the order from VBFA table using invoice number, VBTYP_V = C and VBTYP_N = M. With this logic no order is selected for the invoice specified.
Could you please check and let me know which should be the correct logic?

Best Regards,
Ligia

Hi Evangelos
do you have news about this issue?

I still have the same issue.
Could you please check in PI ?

I get this error:
com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: com.sap.engine.interfaces.messaging.api.exception.MessagingException: Error encountered while executing mapping: com.sap.aii.af.service.mapping.MappingException:
Runtime Exception when executing application mapping program com/sap/xi/tf/MM_IF16_SearchInvoices_to_IF16_SearchInvoices_Response; Details: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException; Cannot create target element /ns1:InvoiceSearchResponse/invoices/orders. Values missing in queue context. Target XSD requires a value for this element, but the target-field mapping does not create one.
Check whether the XML instance is valid for the source XSD, and whether the target-field mapping fulfils the requirement of the target XSD
Ligia, was it corrected on SAP?

Hi Evangelos,

Please check my message from 03.07.2014. I didn't received any feedback for it until now from you.

Best Regards and thank you for your support,
Ligia

Hello Ligia,
It seems that we need a small adjustment here as this invoice is a special one and we don't cover this case until now. We need to cover VBTYP_V = "C" or VBTYP_V = "I".
Please forward it over and we see. On top of that please also select invoices VBRK for FKART = F2.

Hi Evangelos,

I implemented the changes. You can test in Q10.

Best Regards,
Ligia
That should be fine in Dev now Francesco. Please let me know

Hi Evangelos,
now the service is working. Thank you.

I've found another issue on the date format.
I get some wrong data for invoice: 7350000013

<invoiceId>7350000013</invoiceId>
<invoiceDate>20131111</invoiceDate>
<invoiceDueDate>00000000</invoiceDueDate>
<invoiceStatus>Open</invoiceStatus>
<invoiceTotal>0.0</invoiceTotal>

As you can see the invoiceDueDate is 00000000

Could you please have a look?

Hello Ligia,
what do we export in the invoiceduedate? I am probably missing something there.

Hi Evangelos,
We are exporting BSEG-ZFBDT. I think this issue is for the special case we implemented earlier because the invoice ID cannot be found in BSEG.
Best Regards,
Ligia

Hello Francesco,
This item is lets say paid. What should we show there?

The value 00000000 is not a date.
The field invoiceDueDate has been defined in PI to be a "Date" type.
It has also been defined as mandatory.
This means that the value contained inside the invoiceDueDate must be a valid date.

Hello Francesco,
We have no value there and its not correct to add any value. What should we do? should we just send empty?

If no value is present in SAP this means that this field is not mandatory and should be empty.
Could you also check with Maciej the structure of the Search Invoice Response?
At the moment the invoiceDueDate field is mandatory, and should be defined as optional.

I'm going to modify the specification in the wiki.
https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/IF-16+Invoice+Service

Hi Evangelos,
do you have any news on this?
At the moment i'm still receiving 00000000 in invoiceDueDate for invoice 7350000013.

Hello Marcin,
Do you have any update with that?

Hi Evangelos,

The situation is still same, we are still receiving 00000000 in invoiceDueDate for invoice 7350000013.
Here is the response xml


      <customerId>1000391</customerId>
         <invoices>
            <invoiceId>7350000013</invoiceId>
            <invoiceDate>20131111</invoiceDate>
            <invoiceDueDate/>
            <invoiceStatus>Open</invoiceStatus>
            <invoiceTotal>0.0</invoiceTotal>
            <currencyCode>EUR</currencyCode>
            <orders>
               <orderId>0000000647</orderId>
               <contactName>Carsten Freese</contactName>
            </orders>
            <invoiceDocId/>
         </invoices>
Looks like it is still defined as mandatory in PI. I'll make an update.
I updated response definition, please re-test.

Hi Maciej,

I retested it just now and got the same response. Still receiving 00000000 in invoiceDueDate for invoice 7350000013.

See below :- 

<SOAP:Envelope xmlns:SOAP="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
   <SOAP:Header/>
   <SOAP:Body>
      <ns1:InvoiceSearchResponse xmlns:ns1="http://www.distrelec.com/hybris">

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4876] DE - MyAccount Issue
item.description:
Issue

  1. When clicking on "Login-Data" in MyAccount, a message pops up before the page loads -> See screenshot.

Actions

  • This message should not appear. Please find a fix.

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment: Should be fixed after next deployment.

This will be fixed through DISTRELEC-4673 (Sprint 2)
You can include this fix as well
thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4899] B2B Keyaccount Checkut Address Page clear selected Shipping address
item.description:
As of now, if a B2B Key Account User has multiple Billing addresses and selects one of them, a shipping address gets pre selected.

When after that he changes his billing address again, the previously set shipping address id gets cleared out in the hidden text field, the shipping address stays selected visually.

Make it so, that it also gets cleared visually so the user gets forced to select a shipping address again.

Also refactor the checkout address section to have 2 skins for normal b2b and b2b keyaccount.
item.summary: B2B Keyaccount Checkut Address Page clear selected Shipping address

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
